meanings.definition: The act of supplanting or replacing someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her supplantations in the company led to her promotion.
meanings.sent2: The supplantations of old technology with new ones improved efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The supplantations of the office coffee machine caused quite a stir among the employees.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of ideas, creativity often thrives on the supplantations of outdated concepts.
meanings.sent5: The supplantations of traditional teaching methods with modern technology revolutionized education.

meanings.definition: The process of taking the place of another.
meanings.sent1: The supplantations of the new product quickly gained market share.
meanings.sent2: His supplantations in the team made him a valuable player.
meanings.sent3: The supplantations of the lead singer in the band surprised everyone at the concert.
meanings.sent4: In nature, the supplantations of dominant species can lead to ecosystem changes.
meanings.sent5: The supplantations of the old tradition with a new ritual brought fresh energy to the community.
